alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a steroid moiety which bears a carboxylic acid ester group.
alternative_parents.name: Steroid esters

alternative_parents.description: Steroid derivatives carrying a C=O group at the 20-position of the steroid skeleton.
alternative_parents.name: 20-oxosteroids

alternative_parents.description: Hydroxysteroids carrying a beta-hydroxyl group at the 11-position.
alternative_parents.name: 11-beta-hydroxysteroids

alternative_parents.description: 3-oxo steroids containing a double bond between positions 1 and 2, as well as positions 4 and 5.
alternative_parents.name: 3-oxo delta-1,4-steroids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an steroid backbone, with at least one hydrogen substituted by a halogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Halogenated steroids

alternative_parents.description: Steroids containing a double bond between positions 1 and 2, as well as positions 4 and 5.
alternative_parents.name: Delta-1,4-steroids

alternative_parents.description: Ketones that have an acyloxy substituent alpha to the carbonyl group. They have the general structure R4C(=O)OC(R2)(R3)C(R1)=O (R1=organyl, R4=H or organyl; R2,R3 = any atom).
alternative_parents.name: Alpha-acyloxy ketones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds contaning a chlorine atom attached to the alpha carbon atom relative to C=O group.
alternative_parents.name: Alpha-chloroketones

alternative_parents.description: Alcohols substituted by a fluorine atom at a saturated carbon atom otherwise bearing only hydrogen or hydrocarbyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Fluorohydrins

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a ketone that is conjugated to a cyclic moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Cyclic ketones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an aliphatic ring substituted with at least one hydroxyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Cyclic alcohols and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acid derivatives in which the carbon atom from the carbonyl group is attached to an alkyl or an aryl moiety through an oxygen atom (forming an ester group).
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acid esters

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl fluoride functional group with formula R-F , where R is an alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl fluorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl chloride functional group with formula R-Cl , where R is an alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl chlorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Compounds based on the cyclopenta[a]phenanthrene carbon skeleton, partially or completely hydrogenated; there are usually methyl groups at C-10 and C-13, and often an alkyl group at C-17. By extension, one or more bond scissions, ring expansions and/or ring contractions of the skeleton may have occurred.
class.name: Steroids and steroid derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as gluco/mineralocorticoids, progestogins and derivatives. These are steroids with a structure based on a hydroxylated prostane moiety.

direct_parent.description: Steroids with a structure based on a hydroxylated prostane moiety.
direct_parent.name: Gluco/mineralocorticoids, progestogins and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Steroids with a structure based on the 21-carbon pregnane skeleton.
subclass.name: Pregnane steroids

superclass.description: Fatty acids and their derivatives, and substances related biosynthetically or functionally to these compounds.
superclass.name: Lipids and lipid-like molecules
